instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00045: What is 820-00045? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no liquid damage. takes charge, touchpad clicks, blank screen
threads.message: have a 12 incher here, takes 20V on the charger and current is going in. In fact the touchpad also clicks. I tested with a known working display without any luck. These boards are super weird, where do i begin?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no liquid damage. takes charge, touchpad clicks, blank screen
threads.message:
Start listening some classic for these boards... "Return to Sender"

Did you test external video at least?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no liquid damage. takes charge, touchpad clicks, blank screen
threads.message:
Hahahaha oh no! 
I just realised that my initial assessment of liquid damage might be wrong. there's liquid (or oil) all around the underside of the board where it sits on the seal. 
Yes external video I tested as well, no sign of life (except the click on  the trackpad)

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no liquid damage. takes charge, touchpad clicks, blank screen
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no liquid damage. takes charge, touchpad clicks, blank screen
threads.message: Really?? Is there a way I can confirm this?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no liquid damage. takes charge, touchpad clicks, blank screen
threads.message:
It?s a 12? MacBook. That?s all the confirmation you need...

If customer needs data, try reflowing or reballing the CPU. If they don?t need data, throw it in the trash

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no liquid damage. takes charge, touchpad clicks, blank screen
threads.message: Ok, i cancelled the repair. thank you guys. I couldve wasted way more time on it haha
